availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Branch of the U.S. military concerned with military justice and military law. Position of Judge Advocate General established by General George Washington on July 29, 1775. Judge Advocate Corps created in 1862 when Congress authorized the appointment of Judge Advocates in the field, with each assigned to a specific field commander. Commander(s): John F. Lee (1849-1862), Joseph Holt (1862-1875).

ab.bibl: Army JAG Corps, "History," United States Army, (accessed May 2, 2019).
